item.content:encoded:
Love Is Not Enough

by Matthew Nolan on 11/17/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Adventures »
  • Comic »
  • Favorites

Erika’s sick in bed today (Monday as I write this), so I’m doing all the prep work for today’s comic. Usually, I’d write all kinds of thing-a-ma-bobs, but since I know Erika will want to fill this blog post up with all kinds of helpful stuff. I’m going to leave it pretty sparse, so she can come in and replace it all when she feels better.

Check back later on, and hopefully, Erika will have written up something. <3 As always, hope this finds you happy and well friends.

└ Tags: autobio, break up, heart broken, past self

Just in case today’s comic has piqued your interest, go check out some of our other comics on this subject!

Then, if you’re in the mood to buy Lingerie, our recommendation would be to go out to one of those fancy stores and physically try stuff on. It’s SO hard to find what fits and looks good on you without seeing it in a mirror. But… Covid. So instead we’d encourage you to buy online and maybe try our pals Lovehoneys (UK) (Aus) as they have a huge selection.

I’d been drawn to it while browsing the Early to Bed storefront – it looked sleek, colorful, and futuristic, but still small and dainty, and I thought, heck, Erika will love this. Turns out I was sort of right? It’s a toy that has […]
item.content:encoded:
Ultra Wand

by Matthew Nolan on 10/20/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Review Comics »
  • Vibrators

Thank you to FemmeFunn for sending us this cute lil wand!

I’d been drawn to it while browsing the Early to Bed storefront – it looked sleek, colorful, and futuristic, but still small and dainty, and I thought, heck, Erika will love this.

Turns out I was sort of right? It’s a toy that has a fair few OJST-caveats that will make it perfect for some and not-so-perfect for others! It’s definitely not for the faint of heart or for people who want a stealthy wank.

Actually, that’s something that Erika didn’t really mention about the Ultra Wand. It is LOUD. Like, I work a few rooms away from the bedroom and I could hear this thing through the WALLS. Just like Harry Potters Golden Egg, it NEEDS to be under the water – it both helps dampen the vibes AND noise. The Ultra Wand is for those of you who love to have bath-time-fun and live in a situation where you can go loud n proud with your sesh.

We’re happy to have met it!

Buy a Ultra Wand from a Friend (With Benefits)

  • PleasureChest
  • FemmeFunn

item.title: Sponsors 2020
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: Holy cow, can you believe Oh Joy Sex Toy has been ad-free for three years now, thanks to our generous sponsors? We are so proud of the smooth reading experience our site offers and we’re proud to have the support and endorsement of sex positive companies of whom we were already big fans, long before […]
item.content:encoded:
Sponsors 2020

by Erika Moen on 10/06/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Porn & Websites »
  • Review Comics »
  • Vibrators

Holy cow, can you believe Oh Joy Sex Toy has been ad-free for three years now, thanks to our generous sponsors? We are so proud of the smooth reading experience our site offers and we’re proud to have the support and endorsement of sex positive companies of whom we were already big fans, long before we started working together. It’s a win-win!

Matt and I are so delighted that for the third year in a row, we got a big ol’ YES! from OMGyes! From the moment I dove into their pussy lovin’ site, I knew this was something special, something unique. A better educational resource for learning how to interact with vulvas does not exist, in my humble opinion.

This year comes with a new addition, as we are proud to be joined by Wand by We-Vibe on the team. We-Vibe continues to impress us with their creativity and toy quality and their newest creation, Wand, genuinely blew our minds. I didn’t think it was possible to improve on the classic vibrator wand design, but guess what? They did. Catch up on my earlier review to learn all about Smart Silence™ and how it’s an absolute sex toy game-changer.

Now, ok, of course we’re gunna say good things about our sponsors, right? They’re supporting us, after all! But, here’s the thing: we’ve been fans of these companies for years, long, long before Matt and I started talking about pivoting away from ads. We handpick our sponsors and we tell them upfront that we will only give honest reviews of their products; if we have criticism, we will include it (And we have!). All that said… We really are fans of OMGyes and Wand by We-Vibe. Like. It’s so easy to be sponsored by companies who you genuinely already support and admire because they make good products and are doing what they can to make the world a little bit of a better, more sex positive place.

Like I said: Win-Win!

└ Tags: omg yes, omgyes, omgyes.com, sponsor, Sponsors, vibe, vibrator, wand, we-vibe, wevibe

Not too much to report from over here in Portland. With the way the world is right now, Erika and I are just trying to get by day-to-day. At the very least the skies have cleared and we no longer have to live in n95 masks inside our house from the wildfire smoke. We’re starting to prep for when our Kickstarter books arrive and we have to do fulfillment – getting excited!

We’re super excited to be headlined and supported by OMGYes.com and We-Vibe for the next 12 months! We’ve got plans to do a comic where we talk about the sponsorship (maybe in the next […]
item.content:encoded:
Verge by We-Vibe

by Matthew Nolan on 09/22/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Couples Toys »
  • Penis Toys »
  • Review Comics

The eagled eyed of you out there might have noticed that we’ve just updated our Sponsorship on OJST for the year! We’re super excited to be headlined and supported by OMGYes.com and We-Vibe for the next 12 months! We’ve got plans to do a comic where we talk about the sponsorship (maybe in the next week or two). But that’s getting way ahead of ourselves – for the moment – we thought it would be timely to get our We-Vibe Verge review up! We’ve had this one in the wings for a few weeks now, but with all the smoke and sickness in Portland we’ve only JUST finished it (like seriously, we finished it with only hours to go).

item.title: Social Languages by Mariana Meira
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: I love comics like this. Mariana made us such a relatable lil story I think we can a lot of us can connect to! Who has ever truly felt comfortable on a hookup app? We’re lucky that we’ve got a second Mariana comic in the wings scheduled for later too! Go drop her a hello […]
item.content:encoded:
Social Languages by Mariana Meira

by Matthew Nolan on 09/15/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Story Comics »
  • Interviews

I love comics like this. Mariana made us such a relatable lil story I think we can a lot of us can connect to! Who has ever truly felt comfortable on a hookup app?

We’re lucky that we’ve got a second Mariana comic in the wings scheduled for later too! Go drop her a hello and say hi for us!

  • Twitter
  • Portfolio
  • Tumblr
  • Instagram
  • Kofi

Portland has been under a cloud of smoke this past week, so bad that we’re unable to even step foot outside and have to sleep in our useless-for-covid-but-good-for-smoke n95 masks (granted, so many folks on the west coast are having it worse). I mean, it’s in keeping with the 2020 theme and, at this point, it sort of feels like ‘ok yeah, sure, we should have expected this’. The time off we wanted to take last week? Disappeared into a haze of depression and… smoke. Things are supposed to be getting better later today with some scheduled rain. So keep your fingers crossed for us?! Hopefully, with some fresh air, we’ll bounce back into gear and a modicum of normality =)

If you’re also feeling the effects of the smoke and fires – man, our thoughts are with you. But also even if you’re NOT feeling the effects of smoke/fire – and just feeling ‘it’ – our thoughts are with you too. Things are hard!!! But you can do this. One day at a time. <3

Project Spotlight:

PDX Sex Workers Relief Fund



If you’re looking for ways to help support Sex Workers affected by the wild fires in Oregon, please join us in donating to the PDX Sex Worker Relief fund, which pays micro grants to BIPOC Sex Workers in the state. You can make a tax deductible donation through their fiscal sponsor, Call to Safety, or you can make a non-tax deductible donation by Venmo-ing PDXworkerrelief

└ Tags: apps, autobio, brazil, casual sex, guest, guest comic, hook-up, Mariana Meira, social language, swipe

item.title: Quarantine Diary: Day 5
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: Those mermaid leggings were bought on sale from Ambrie.com after a very well-targeted ad on Instagram was placed in my feed. Well played, The Algorithm. Well played. Matt and I were just going to skip an update this week but then, like, I felt bad about not having a comic for OJST’s readers, so instead […]
item.content:encoded:
Quarantine Diary: Day 5

by Erika Moen on 09/08/2020 at 12:02 am
  • Comic

Those mermaid leggings were bought on sale from Ambrie.com after a very well-targeted ad on Instagram was placed in my feed. Well played, The Algorithm. Well played.

Matt and I were just going to skip an update this week but then, like, I felt bad about not having a comic for OJST’s readers, so instead I decided to re-use this story I drew just for my Exclusive Autobio Comics tier patrons a few months ago. If you enjoy my journal comics, hey, there’s more of them where this one came from over on Patreon.

We’ve only ever completely skipped an update once before– it was either this last Christmas or the one before that. We put up a temporary image on the site saying “be back next week!” or something and as soon as the next comic was up, we deleted the placeholder from the archives. We never got any notes from folks about it, I wonder if anyone actually saw it.

There’s an orange tint in the air from the California fires. It’s kind of pretty, in an apocalyptic-sort of way. Matt and I are doing a bunch of file and coding prep work this week before we announce our sponsors for the next year, but also… dang, man. It’s tempting to blame our exhaustion on the smokey air clogging up our lungs and slowing down our synapses, but I think we’re also simultaneously Legitimately Out of Juice, regardless of environmental factors. Not in a bad way! Just a… We’re-In-Our-Mid-To-Late-30s-And-We’re-Tired way. But also: The-Air-is-Literally-Orange-and-Smells-Like-Burning way, too.

See y’all next week. Stay safe.

Be responsible when collecting your mermaid leggings.

└ Tags: autobio, quarantine
